title: Improving Peer Relationships of Children with Autism Spectrum Disorder Through Inclusive Curriculum Design

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental educational theories and general understanding of child development
context.additional_context: Combines theory with field application case studies for current practitioners, integrating online learning via digital devices and offline workshops

learning_goals: Analyze peer relationship types in children with Autism Spectrum Disorder and propose support strategies for each type.
Apply teaching methods that promote interaction between children with disabilities and typically developing peers through inclusive curriculum design.
Identify protective and risk factors influencing peer relationship formation in classroom settings and design improvement plans.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
